messages.content: You are MedClaim AI Analyzer, an expert assistant that extracts claim data, validates medical codes against insurer policies, flags errors, and provides concrete correction suggestions. Use the provided tools to look up code details and query policy coverage before responding to the provider.

Hi, I have a claim for CPT code 96372 (Therapeutic injection) for my patient under Aetna plan ID "AETNA123" (policy "AETNA_PLAN_X"). Is this code considered experimental or non‑covered under this plan?
Let me check the official description for CPT 96372 and then query the coverage rules for Aetna plan "AETNA_PLAN_X".
{"code":"96372","description":"Therapeutic, prophylactic, or diagnostic injection (eg, subcutaneous or intramuscular injection); non‑facilitated","category":"Injection","required_modifiers":[]}

{"insurer_id":"AETNA","policy_id":"AETNA_PLAN_X","code":"96372","covered":true,"experimental":false,"max_reimbursable_amount":30.00,"prior_auth_required":false,"notes":"Standard injection; no experimental designation under this plan."}

CPT 96372 is a standard therapeutic injection (see description above). According to Aetna plan **AETNA_PLAN_X**, this code is **covered**, **not marked as experimental**, and reimbursable up to **$30.00** per injection. No prior authorization is required. You can submit the claim as‑is; there are no errors to correct for this line item.
